Package it.polimi.se2019.controller

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.controller.Observer
      • it.polimi.se2019.controller.GameController
  • public class GameController
extends Observer
    Controller class related to a single game. Handles the game flow, using match properties. Supports:
  • PowerUp with Moment.OWNROUND activation, using EffectController
  • Game ending and related winnes sending
  • Action selection

  • turnEnd

    private boolean turnEnd
    Flag to indicate that the current turn ended, for different reasons:
  • The players has no more actions.

  • skip

    private boolean skip
    Flag to indicate that the current player has to skips action in his current turn. True when the player didn't answer in time, getting blocked for the current turn.

  • action

    private boolean action
    Whether EffectController is computing an action or not.

  • dominationOverkill

    private boolean dominationOverkill
    Flag to indicate whether the controller is waiting for answers for overkilled players in DominationMode.

  • Constructor Detail

    • GameController

      public GameController​(java.util.List<Player> players,
                      java.lang.String boardName,
                      int numSkulls,
                      boolean domination,
                      LobbyController lobbyController)
      Creates a GameController istance, managing the flow of the game. Contains the information required to create a new Match, the mode of the new Match, and the related lobbyController.
      Parameters:
      players - clients playing the game
      boardName - refers to the name of the board (chosen randomly) used
      numSkulls - number of max skulls in the board.
      domination - whether the mode is domination or not
      lobbyController -

  • Method Detail

    • checkEnd

      public void checkEnd​(java.lang.String username)
      Handles the disconnection of a player, communicating to other players that the player got disconnected. Calls the related checkEnd method, checking if the game needs to stop.
      Parameters:
      username -

    • checkEnd

      public void checkEnd()
      Checks if the game needs to stop prematurely for lack of players. Notify the players sending the winners if the game ends.

    • updateOnAction

      public void updateOnAction​(Action action)
      Handles receiving an action from the client, starting the related actionController.
      Overrides:
      updateOnAction in class Observer
      Parameters:
      action - chose by the corresponding client.

    • updateOnPlayers

      public void updateOnPlayers​(java.util.List<Player> players)
      Handles receiving a List of players from the client. Used for domination spawn overkill, in Domination mode. It updates the countDownLatch.
      Overrides:
      updateOnPlayers in class Observer
      Parameters:
      players -

    • updateOnPowerUps

      public void updateOnPowerUps​(java.util.List<PowerUp> powerUps)
      Handles receiving a List of powerUps from the client. Used for:
    • Spawning players at the start of the Game
    • Choosing powerUps, and start the related #effectController.
      • Overrides:
      updateOnPowerUps in class Observer
      Parameters:
      powerUps -

    • startTurn

      public void startTurn()

    • playTurn

      public void playTurn()
      Handles the start of the turn Prompt the client with an action and/or powerups and/or the chance to stop the current turn. Check if the turn is ended (if the player used a Reload action)

    • getMatch

      public Match getMatch()
      Description copied from class: Observer
      Gets the match that is being computed.
      Specified by:
      getMatch in class Observer
      Returns:

    • checkEndTurn

      private boolean checkEndTurn()
      Checks whether the player has to end its turn. It checks:
    • If the player has done all of its action
    • If there are no more usable powerUps during his turn
    • If there is the option to reload, or if the player already reloaded
      • Returns:

    • updateOnConclusion

      public void updateOnConclusion()
      Handles the conclusion of the action. It sets back the eventHelper to the original match. It continues the flow of the turn, ending it or asking for the next action to the player.
      Overrides:
      updateOnConclusion in class Observer

    • checkDominationOverKill

      public void checkDominationOverKill​(boolean toSkip)
      Checks if there are spawnPoints AND any overkilled Player, to assign the overkill damage to one of the spawns. If the currentPlayer is offline, the assignable damages will go to a random spawn.

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn​(boolean toSkip)
      Handles the ending of the turn. Handles the deposit of the overkill of players in DominationMode into SpawnPoints of choice.
      Parameters:
      toSkip - true when the player

    • sendWinners

      public void sendWinners()
      Send winners to the players, parsing them using Match.getWinners(). Handles putting players offline once the game ended. Sends to the player the list of the winners.

    • startSpawning

      public void startSpawning()
      Handles the spawning of players after their death.
    • It selects a random point if they are offline.
    • It handles the online players asynchronously.

    • updateOnStopSelection

      public void updateOnStopSelection​(ThreeState skip)
      Handles receiving a stop selection.
    • If dominationOverkill is true, the latch's count get decreased
    • If the current player is spawning at the end of the game, a random SpawnPoing gets selected
    • If the skip is a non-reverse skip, the turn ends and the player gets eventually prompted.
    • If the skip is a reverse skip, the turn ends and the player doesn't get prompted.
      • Overrides:
      updateOnStopSelection in class Observer
